title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

(Exempted Development) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2023. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development (exempted development) regulation 2023 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2023 interpretation

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 3. Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the
text_raw:
3. Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the 

following definition after the definition of “repository”: 

“ “reverse vending machine” means a machine for the purpose of 
accepting in-scope bottles and in-scope containers, reimbursing deposits 
for each item accepted, and retaining the items accepted for collection, 
within the meaning of the Separate Collection (Deposit Return Scheme) 
Regulations 2021(S.I. No. 599 of 2021)” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 26th May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [250] 3 

Amendment of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 3 article 5(1) principal regulation amended inserting following definition definition repository reverse vending machine mean machine purpose accepting in-scope bottle in-scope container reimbursing deposit item accepted retaining item accepted collection within meaning separate collection (deposit return scheme) regulation 2021(s.i no 599 2021) notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 26th may 2023 250 3 amendment part 1 schedule 2 principal regulation

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 4. Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations is amended by
text_raw:
4. Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations is amended by 

inserting the following Class after Class 42: 

" 

CLASS 42A 

(a) the installation, 

alteration, repair or 
replacement of a reverse 
vending machine within 
the curtilage of a shop 
where: 

i. The opening of the 
reverse vending 
machine is located on 
an inner wall of the 
shop while storage 
unit and associated 
roofed area are 
developed to the 
outside. 

ii. The reverse vending 

machine together 
with storage unit and 
associated roofed 
area operates 
ancillary to the shop.
text_norm: 4 part 1 schedule 2 principal regulation amended inserting following class class 42 class 42a (a) installation alteration repair replacement reverse vending machine within curtilage shop i opening reverse vending machine located inner wall shop storage unit associated roofed area developed outside ii reverse vending machine together storage unit associated roofed area operates ancillary shop

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 1. No such structure shall be
text_raw:
1. No such structure shall be 
attached to the front wall 
of the building or erected 
forward of the front 
building line.
text_norm: 1 structure shall attached front wall building erected forward front building line

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 2. (a) The height of the walls
text_raw:
2. (a) The height of the walls 
of any such structure shall 
not exceed the height of 
the walls of the existing 
building to which it is 
attached. 
(b) The height of the 
highest part of the roof of 
any such structure shall 
not exceed, in the case of 
a flat roofed structure, 3.0 
metres or the height of the 
eaves or parapet, as may 
be appropriate, whichever 
is the lesser, or in any 
other case shall not exceed
text_norm: 2 (a) height wall structure shall exceed height wall existing building attached (b) height highest part roof structure shall exceed case flat roofed structure 3.0 metre height eaves parapet may appropriate whichever lesser case shall exceed

3.5 metres or the height of 
the highest part of the roof 
of the existing building, 
whichever is the lesser.
text_norm: 3.5 metre height highest part roof existing building whichever lesser

heading: 3. The footprint shall not
text_raw:
3. The footprint shall not 

exceed 25 square metres. 

(b) the installation, 

alteration, repair or 
replacement of a reverse 
vending machine, 
storage unit and 
associated ancillary 
roofed area if required 
within the curtilage of a 
shop detached from main 
building.

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 1. The height of the highest
text_raw:
1. The height of the highest 
part of the roof of any 
such structure shall not

of the roof of the closest 
building, whichever is the 
lesser.

title: following regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper
heading: 2. The total footprint shall
text_raw:
2. The total footprint shall 
not exceed 6 square 
metres allowing for a 
combination of up to three 
reverse vending machines. 

(d) the construction of 
bollards, not exceeding – 

(i) 1.2 metres in 
height, and 
(ii) 0.2 cubic metres 
by volume above 
ground, 

and warning signs for the 
purpose of protecting such 
Vending Machines and 
persons. 

The following condition 
applies to subsections b and c 
of Class 42A: 

No reverse vending 
machine or storage 
area containing such 
machines shall be 
placed on pre-existing 
disabled persons’ 
parking bays. 

The following conditions 
apply to all subsections of 
Class 42A: 

i. No reverse 

vending machine 
or associated 
bollards and 
signage shall be 
placed obstructing 
emergency exits or 
emergency 
evacuation paths. 

ii. No reverse 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [250] 5 

vending machine 
shall be placed on 
a footpath or 
public road and 
associated bollards 
and signage shall 
not obstruct a 
footpath. 

iii. No reverse 

vending machine 
shall be situated, 
located or 
developed such 
that vehicular 
access to the 
machine 
(including its 
associated storage) 
for the purpose of 
the installation, 
alteration, repair, 
replacement, 
removal, use or 
emptying of the 
machine, would 
endanger public 
safety by reason of 
traffic hazard or 
obstruction of 
persons using, 
accessing or 
egressing the shop, 
land or machine in 
question. 
The external 
finishes of the 
reverse vending 
machine shall 
conform in style 
with its 
surroundings. 

iv. 

v. No reverse 

vending machine 
shall be situated 
within 20 metres of 
the curtilage of any 
house, save with 
the consent in 
writing of the 
owner or occupier 

 
 6 [250] 

thereof. 
vi. Advertising 

signage or other 
advertising 
material shall not 
be affixed to, or 
placed at, the 
reverse vending 
machine or storage 
area containing 
such machine other 
than for the 
purpose of – 
(a) identifying the 
machine, 
(b) warning signs 
for the purpose of 
protecting persons, 
(c) providing 
instructions in 
relation to the use 
of the machine, or 
(d) providing the 
contact details of 
the operator, 
manager or owner 
of the machine. 

" 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

19 May, 2023. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister of Housing, Planning and Local Government.
